string.value: There is also an additional objective.
The headquarters receives data on biogenic contamination of the area, which is why the chemical protection force asks you to collect soil samples from different places in the canyon.
Naturally, this must not be at the expense of saving the scientist. And beware of giant mushrooms, it seems to me that all the toxin is collected in them.
My advice to you: shoot the mushrooms at every opportunity.
The problem has an extremely simple solution, yes. Nothing complicated.
Your soldiers have probably already driven the bandits into the marshes and defeated them all. They have all sorts of guns, grenades and other stuff, yes.
But my research! My materials! The soldiers wouldn't even think about getting them out of there, I'm sure of it! You think I don't know what the military are all like?
They will shoot everything there, cause a leak of Z-120 and destroy valuable samples!
Basically, it's either you or me! I mean, either you get the materials, or I stay here, yeah! So go to the swamp, that's it!
I don't understand. I have the photographs of this area from a month ago on the desk in front of me. It was nothing like the jungle it is that we're seeing right now.
Anyway, we know where Dr. Pappers is, so it's just about getting him out alive and well.
Agent, do you copy? Come in! Switch to alternate frequency! Agent, respond, over!
Agent, if you can hear me, press the "transmit" button twice. Aha, great! Looks like this place is in the radio shadow…
As soon as you get the scientist out… At the entrance to the canyon, there will be… waiting for you. Got it?
You've got to be careful to avoid getting caught in Delta's line of fire while rescuing the scientist from the hands of the smugglers.
You came to save me? Oh, great, great! Looks like my government cares enough to rescue me from the bandits after all.

However, I had already rescued myself from the bandits, yes! I escaped while they were refueling. Apparently they were being chased by the military, and they both didn't have time for me. So I managed without you, yes.
We were able to make use of a surveillance satellite passing over the area.
The bandit camp appears to be located not that far away from you. It consists of several large dome-shaped tents, there's a chance that the scientist is being held in one of them.
There are no visual signs of combat near the site. In any case, you'll need to take a look around there.
But don't think that I'll go with you! The smugglers still have all the samples and materials of my research, yes.
I won't go anywhere without them. It's years of work, yeah! Retrieve my papers from the bandits and I'm coming with you, otherwise - no way!
The bandits are trying to escape from the soldiers to the swamps. You can still catch up with them.
Your car is well protected from radiation, this is very bad.
I mean it's great, but bad in the sense that the armor is heavy, and the terrain here is boggy, yes. That's because of the swamp.
ON-BOARD COMPUTER|Scanning…
ON-BOARD COMPUTER|The objects spotted by the satellite's surveillance cameras are not tents. They are giant eggs. Presumably of bird origin.
@ffab1e1eYOU HAVE|LOST !!!!| |@ffccccccYou haven't passed all the checkpoints. On this note the thread of prophecy is severed.
